alert.note: Alert for East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 2:58PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Alameda and north central Santa Clara Counties through 330 PM PDT... At 258 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mt. Hamilton, or 14 miles east of Milpitas, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Alameda and north central Santa Clara Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Bay Hills; Eastern Santa Clara Hills
